member.name: T:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.DotnetControls.DataGridViewBindingDescriptor
member.summary: Encapsulates the metadata about a binding between an object property and a column in a .
member.remarks: Use the DataGridViewBindingDescriptor to create a binding between a column and a business object property. Each binding is added to a using the method. A binding is constructed for a column, together with a or additional property and information.

example.code:
' This example shows various ways of constructing and using DataGridViewBindingDescriptors Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim mgr As New DataGridViewBindingManager(Me.DataGridView1, GetType(Employee))
Dim d1, d2, d3 As DataGridViewBindingDescriptor
' a simple descriptor d1 = New DataGridViewBindingDescriptor("First Name", GetType(Employee), "FirstName")
' using a dataconverter d2 = New DataGridViewBindingDescriptor("Hire Date", GetType(Employee), "HireDate", DataConverter.RequiredDate)
' using a ViewDescriptor Dim vd As New ViewDescriptor("Title", GetType(Employee), "Title") d3 = New DataGridViewBindingDescriptor(vd)
' add the BindingDescriptors to the BindingManager mgr.Descriptors.Add(d1) mgr.Descriptors.Add(d2) mgr.Descriptors.Add(d3)
' add employees to the BindingManager's DataSource now mgr.DataSource.AddRange(pm.GetEntities(Of Employee)())

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.DotnetControls.DataGridViewBindingManager
member.summary: Manages the data binding between a list of business objects and a .NET DataGridView control.

remarks.para: The determines the type of business object to be managed. The is the that contains one or more business objects of the BoundType. Use the property to add DataGridViewBindingDescriptors to bind columns in the DataGridView to business object properties.

When using the DataGridViewBindingManager it is not necessary for you to set the DataGridView's DataSource and DataMember properties, since the bindings will be managed by DevForce. You will also not need to use the DataGridView's Column Editor, as the DataGridViewBindingDescriptors will determine the columns displayed.

example.code:
' This example will bind Customer info to a DataGridView
' Create the BindingManager and BindableList Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim mgr As New DataGridViewBindingManager(Me.DataGridView1, GetType(Customer)) Dim custList As New BindableList(Of Customer)
' Set the DataSource mgr.BindingSource.DataSource = custList
' Add descriptors for the bound properties mgr.Descriptors.Add("Name", "ContactName", DataConverter.RequiredString) mgr.Descriptors.Add("Company", "CompanyName", DataConverter.ReadOnlyString) mgr.Descriptors.Add("Telephone", "Phone", New RegexConverter(Editability.Required, "^(\d{3}-\d{3}-\d{4})*$"))
' Add all Customers to the BindableList custList.AddRange(pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)())

If the developer uses the DefaultConverter's defaults, then the control's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer modifies the DefaultConverter's Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides the control.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and uses the converter's defaults, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter, keeps Editability.Optional, and modifies the ThreeState, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and modifies the Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides its ThreeState.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.DotnetControls.DataGridBindingDescriptor
member.summary: Encapsulates the metadata about a binding between an object property and a column in a .
member.remarks: Use the DataGridBindingDescriptor to create a binding between a column and a business object property. Each binding is added to a using the method. A binding is constructed for a column, together with a or additional property and information.

example.code:
' This example shows various ways of constructing and using DataGridBindingDescriptors Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim mgr As New DataGridBindingManager(Me.dataGrid1, GetType(Employee))
Dim d1, d2, d3 As DataGridBindingDescriptor
' a simple descriptor d1 = New DataGridBindingDescriptor("First Name", GetType(Employee), "FirstName")
' using a dataconverter d2 = New DataGridBindingDescriptor("Hire Date", GetType(Employee), "HireDate", DataConverter.RequiredDate)
' using a ViewDescriptor Dim vd As New ViewDescriptor("Title", GetType(Employee), "Title") d3 = New DataGridBindingDescriptor(vd)
' add the BindingDescriptors to the BindingManager mgr.Descriptors.Add(d1) mgr.Descriptors.Add(d2) mgr.Descriptors.Add(d3)
' add employees to the BindingManager's DataSource now mgr.DataSource.AddRange(pm.GetEntities(Of Employee)())

member.remarks:
Logic for initializing whether the column should support three states is as follows:
If the developer uses the DefaultConverter's defaults, then the column's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer modifies the DefaultConverter's Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides the column.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and uses the converter's defaults, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter, keeps Editability.Optional, and modifies the ThreeState, then the converter's ThreeState value is used.
If the developer selects the ThreeStateConverter and modifies the Editability, then the converter's Editability overrides its ThreeState.

member.name: T:IdeaBlade.UI.WinForms.DotnetControls.DataGridBindingManager
member.summary: Manages the data binding between a list of business objects and a .

remarks.para: The determines the type of business object to be managed. The is the that contains one or more business objects of the BoundType. Use the property to add DataGridBindingDescriptors to bind columns in the DataGrid to business object properties.

example.code:
' This example will bind Customer info to a DataGrid
' Create the BindingManager and BindableList Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim mgr As New DataGridBindingManager(Me.dataGrid1, GetType(Customer)) Dim custList As New BindableList(Of Customer)()
' Set the DataSource mgr.BindingSource.DataSource = custList
' Add descriptors for the bound properties mgr.Descriptors.Add("Name", "ContactName", DataConverter.RequiredString) mgr.Descriptors.Add("Company", "CompanyName", DataConverter.ReadOnlyString) mgr.Descriptors.Add("Telephone", "Phone", New RegexConverter(Editability.Required, "^(\d{3}-\d{3}-\d{4})*$"))
' Add all Customers to the BindableList custList.AddRange(pm.GetEntities(Of Customer)())

' sample showing use of CurrencyManager to synchronize data in 2 grids
Dim pm As PersistenceManager = PersistenceManager.DefaultManager Dim employeeList As New BindableList(Of Employee) Dim orderList As New BindableList(Of Order) Dim mgrEmp As New DataGridBindingManager(Me.dataGrid1, employeeList) Dim mgrOrders As New DataGridBindingManager(Me.dataGrid2, orderList)
'set up a handler for CurrentChanged event - will fire when employee changes in first grid AddHandler mgrEmp.CurrencyManager.CurrentChanged, AddressOf CurrencyManager_CurrentChanged
' load all employees employeeList.AddRange(PersistenceManager.DefaultManager.GetEntities(Of Employee)())
Private Sub CurrencyManager_CurrentChanged(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) ' get the current employee Dim emp As Employee = CType(mgrEmp.CurrencyManager.Current, Employee) ' refill orderList with orders for current employee orderList.ReplaceRange(emp.Orders) End Sub
